# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(text)
        if length(current_line) + length(word) <= text_width
            current_line *= " " * word
        else
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        end
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello there this is a very long sentence that should be wrapped into multiple lines."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 15)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function splits the text into words and builds an array of lines. It appends each word to the current line until the line length exceeds `text_width`. When this happens, it starts a new line and continues with the next word. Finally, it joins all the lines back together with a newline character between them.
